autonomyDescription.observe: Ed monitors, reports, suggests. No actions taken.
autonomyDescription.sandbox: Ed can build/test locally. No external actions.
autonomyDescription.ship-with-gates: Ed builds and ships with David approval gates on: spending, public posts, external emails, App Store submissions, DNS changes.
autonomyDescription.full-execute: Ed acts autonomously. David reviews async.

departments.name: Build / Engineering
departments.topMetric: 6 tools live, 0 apps on App Store
departments.topPriority: Ship MyMeme security + ClawPhone to App Store
departments.detail: 6 Schoolgle tools deployed to GitHub Pages. MyMeme live but needs Phase 2 security. ClawPhone built but not submitted. CricBook in active Codex build. MySongs and MyShow blocked on API keys and Supabase.

departments.name: Marketing
departments.detail: 10 Staff Room newsletter issues written and ready. 5 Remotion animation MP4s rendered. LinkedIn and X launch posts drafted. All content waiting for Substack account creation by David.

departments.name: Finance
departments.detail: Stripe connected for MyMeme but no credit purchases yet (security Phase 2 needed first). Staff Room could generate first MRR within hours of Substack launch. Target: £49.95 MRR from 5 paid subscribers.

products.name: MyMeme
products.nextAction: Add auth to /api/animate, /api/upload, /api/checkout + server-side credit deduction
products.description: AI-powered photo style transfer and caricature generator. Upload a photo, choose a style, get a transformed image. Monetised through credit packs. Website live at mymeme.uk.

weeklyBet.feature: Server-side credit system — prevents localStorage bypass, unlocks paid credits
weeklyBet.distribution: Existing website traffic + ecosystem cross-sell from MySongs/MyShow

decisions.decision: Split security work into Phase 1 (auth middleware) and Phase 2 (server-side credits)
decisions.context: Phase 1 shipped — withAuth() on generate endpoints. Phase 2 needs David approval to proceed.

decisions.decision: Use Stripe for credit pack payments
decisions.context: Stripe connected, checkout flow built. Credits stored in localStorage (Phase 1) → server-side (Phase 2).

products.name: MySongs
products.blocker: No Suno API key configured, never tested
products.nextAction: Get Suno API key, test audio generation quality
products.description: AI music creation platform. Create custom songs from text prompts for birthdays, weddings, occasions. Website live at mysongs.uk but core generation untested.

weeklyBet.feature: Differentiate from Google Lyria 3 — pro controls, longer tracks, custom voices

decisions.decision: Must differentiate from Google Lyria 3 (free AI music)
decisions.context: Google launched free music gen for all Gemini users. MySongs needs pro features Google won't offer.

products.name: MyShow
products.blocker: Needs Supabase project + Sync.so singing audio validation
products.nextAction: David creates Supabase project, then test Sync.so with singing audio
products.description: AI singing video generator. Upload your photo, record your voice, pick a song — get a video of yourself performing. The ecosystem play linking MyMeme → MySongs → MyShow.

weeklyBet.feature: Validate Sync.so lip-sync works with singing (not just speech) — this is the MVP gate
weeklyBet.distribution: Viral mechanics: Rick Astley rickrolls, birthday surprises, TikTok clips

decisions.decision: Use Sync.so for lip-sync, not D-ID
decisions.context: Sync.so offers better singing support. Must validate with actual singing audio before committing.

products.name: ClawPhone
products.nextAction: Investigate blocker, submit to App Store
products.description: Voice AI companion app for iOS. Talk to Ed with character voices powered by Fish Audio TTS. Flask API backend. Ready to submit to App Store.

weeklyBet.feature: Get on App Store — first live consumer app
weeklyBet.distribution: App Store organic discovery + direct marketing

decisions.decision: Use Fish Audio for character TTS voices
decisions.context: Fish Audio provides natural-sounding character voices (SpongeBob, Patrick etc). Flask API backend handles voice routing.

products.name: DealFind
products.blocker: Needs new Supabase project (not old Schoolgle dev DB)
products.nextAction: David creates fresh Supabase project for DealFind
products.description: Deal aggregation platform. React + Vite frontend, needs Supabase backend. Finds and surfaces the best deals.

products.name: CricBook
products.nextAction: Continue Codex build, await Supabase key from David
products.description: Global cricket social network. Expo app targeting India/Pakistan markets. Match threads, social feed, cricket banter. Built with Supabase backend.

weeklyBet.feature: Core social feed + match threads for IPL season

decisions.context: Expo for cross-platform mobile, Supabase for real-time social feed. Targeting IPL 2026 season start.

products.name: Schoolgle Toolbox
products.nextAction: Add remaining 2 calculators (Legionella, AUP AI Policy)
products.description: Free interactive tools for schools embedded in newsletters. NI Calculator, Breakfast Club Calculator, SEND Funding Explorer, KCSIE Checker, Ofsted Explorer, SEND Placement Explorer. All live on GitHub Pages.

weeklyBet.feature: Cross-sell to Staff Room newsletter — every tool drives subscriptions
weeklyBet.distribution: Embedded in newsletters + direct links from social
weeklyBet.metricTarget: 100 unique tool users in first week

decisions.decision: Deploy all tools to GitHub Pages as standalone HTML
decisions.context: Zero hosting cost, instant deployment, embeddable in Substack via iframes.

products.name: Staff Room Newsletter
products.blocker: David needs to create Substack account
products.nextAction: David creates Substack → paste Issue #1 → publish → first revenue
products.description: Paid education newsletter on Substack. Three tiers: Free, Member (£9.99/mo), Pro (£29.99/mo). 10 issues written, interactive tools embedded. Content-to-product pipeline.

weeklyBet.feature: Launch Issue #1 with interactive SEND Funding Explorer embedded

decisions.context: Matches Substack 2026 best practice — membership products beat paywalled articles.
Schoolgle Toolbox tools embedded via iframe. Free tools drive upgrades to paid tiers.

products.name: Schoolgle OS / PWA
products.nextAction: Write spec after other products ship
products.description: Unified mobile experience for schools. Login → school dashboard → app grid with all Schoolgle tools. PWA first approach. Concept stage.

weeklyBet.feature: Unified school home screen with app grid — toolbox apps inside one shell

opportunities.title: Google Lyria 3 — free AI music in Gemini
opportunities.whyItMatters: Free music generation for billions of Gemini users. Direct competition to MySongs.
opportunities.recommendedAction: Differentiate MySongs on longer tracks, pro controls, niche features Google won't touch

opportunities.title: Gemini 3.1 Pro — half-price reasoning model
opportunities.whyItMatters: $2/M input vs $4+ for competitors. Could reduce our model costs significantly.
opportunities.recommendedAction: Test as fallback model for sub-agents and overnight cron tasks

opportunities.title: Education funding crisis deepening
opportunities.whyItMatters: Schools cutting TAs and resources. Validates demand for free/cheap tools like Schoolgle Toolbox.
opportunities.recommendedAction: Use in Staff Room Issue #1 — lead with funding data, cross-sell toolbox

opportunities.title: SEND support staff losing to supermarkets
opportunities.whyItMatters: Emotive story for newsletter — SEND staff can't compete with Aldi wages. Schools suffering.
opportunities.recommendedAction: Write Staff Room deep dive on SEND staffing crisis

opportunities.title: Substack 2026: membership products beat paywalled articles
opportunities.whyItMatters: Staff Room's 3-tier model (free/member/pro) with interactive tools is exactly what's winning in 2026.
opportunities.recommendedAction: Launch Staff Room with confidence — our model matches the winning pattern
